newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Hibbett gains outpace Sabre.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Hibbett gains outpace Sabre.

text.p: Several smaller companies earned solid premiums at their market debuts on Friday in the shadow of Sabre Group Holdings Inc's $545 million initial public offering.
Sabre shares rose six, or 22 percent, to 33. The AMR Corp unit offered 27 million shares for $27 each.
But smaller Hibbett Sporting Goods Inc actually beat Sabre's gains, rising 25 percent to as high as $20 a share from its initial public offering price of $16.
Hibbett offered two million shares. The Birmingham, Alabama company operates sporting goods stores that offer footwear, apparel and equipment.

Analyst Manish Shah of the IPO Maven had singled out the stock as a strong pick for long-term investors: "What is unique about them is that they tie in promotions with local sports games, creating a lot of traffic. It's very clever."
Other companies that made their IPO debuts Friday:

-- Superior TeleCom Inc, a New York, New York-based manufacturer of wire and cable, rose 1-1/4 to 17-1/4 from its IPO price of $16 each. It priced at the top of its estimated price range of $14 to $15.
The company is a unit of Alpine Group Inc, which plans to retain a majority stake after the offering.

-- Xomed Surgical Products Inc shares rose to 22-3/4 from its IPO price of $21. The company makes surgical products to be used by ear, nose and throat specialists. Alex. Brown & Sons was the lead manager of the offering.
-- Medical Alliance Inc shares rose one to 12 after their market debut. It offered two million shares, which priced at the low end of their $11 to $13 a share range.
The company creates temporary surgical sites in physician offices for medical surgery, such as gynecology and podiatry, and other services, such as tatoo removal and skin resurfacing.
-- White Pine Software Inc shares edged up 1/4 to 9. The Nashua, New Hampshire company develops desktop connectivity software.
-- Intensiva HealthCare Corp shares rose 5/8 to 6-5/8.
-- FaxSave Inc shares were flat at their IPO price of $8. The company makes business-to-business facsimile transmission systems.
